page.title: 17WELLINGTON HEATH AMENITIES
page.content: The{local school closed}in 1955 and all children{travel}to schools in Ledbury or Colwall. As the village is within a 3 mile radius of either school, children{must pay for the {bus,}which is a{sore point.}However, villagers are also allowed to use this {bus}which is useful,as otherwise there is only a once{weekly private service. The local shop and Post Office closed 4 years ago and there is only a{milk {and a baker's round.}The{milkman}also {delivers information}twice yearly, ie slips of paper produced by the Parish Council and the Memorial Hall, which {report on the village organisations. Apart from this there are{four inform- {ation}notice boards in the village. There is a fortnightly{collection of {refuse}and a{mobile library}visits the area once a month. There is a{Nurse and Health Visitor.
